A new artificial intelligence system called a semantic decoder can translate a person’s brain activity — while listening to a story or silently imagining telling a story — into a continuous stream of text. In 2017, more than 8.5 million fake comments that impersonated real people were submitted to the FCC, which the Trump Administration used as cover to repeal "net neutrality" internet regulations, and more than half a million fake letters were sent to Congress, according to the NY Attorney General who secured large fines against the firms hired by Internet providers to bombard the government with their side.

sketch_2022_05_14 #Processing #py5 #Python

"""
Code using https://py5coding.org "imported mode" style, learn more
at https://abav.lugaralgum.com/como-instalar-py5/index-EN.html
"""

tam = 30

def setup():
size(600, 600)
fill(0)
rect_mode(CENTER)

def draw():
background(240)
rows = cols = width // tam
for r in range(rows):
y = tam / 2 + r * tam
for c in range(cols):
x = tam / 2 + c * tam
d = 20 - c - r
if d > 0:
circle(x, y, d + 5)
else:
square(x, y, d - 5)

sketch_2022_05_14 #Processing #py5 #Python

"""
Code using https://py5coding.org "imported mode" style, learn more
at https://abav.lugaralgum.com/como-instalar-py5/index-EN.html
"""

tam = 30

def setup():
size(600, 600)
fill(0)
rect_mode(CENTER)

def draw():
background(240)
rows = cols = width // tam
for r in range(rows):
y = tam / 2 + r * tam
for c in range(cols):
x = tam / 2 + c * tam
d = 20 - c - r
if d > 0:
circle(x, y, d + 5)
else:
square(x, y, d - 5)

title: ​​The 'Past Exonerative Tense' In Stories About Police Killings, Traffic Violence

last_post.content:
"Officer-involved shooting" is a euphemism for "officer shot someone" -- and it's used, by police and journalist, to make reality fuzzy.

If all journalism organizations agreed to, as this commentary advises, abolish the "Exonerative Tense” in headlines (and I'd add, articles as well), journalism would be much improved.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/emersonmalone/police-traffic-safety-headline-language-exoneration
The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Character-Level Language Models - https://colab.research.google.com/github/norvig/pytudes/blob/main/ipynb/Goldberg.ipynb

And this is why it’s actually important for Bluesky to decentralize now rather than later.

Rip the band-aid off so that people on #Blueksy all realize what they’re signing up for.

I'll be unavailable for this but this looks fun. Entirely online: https://abcde.puzzlefactory.place/

title: Saving time and money in biomedical publishing: the case for free-format submissions with minimal requirements - BMC Medicine

last_post.content:
Journal formatting requirements are a huge drain on authors. Journals can fix this problem.

New study: "By calculating average researcher salaries in the European Union and the USA, and the time spent on reformatting articles, we estimated that ~ 230 million USD were lost in 2021 alone due to reformatting articles. Should the current practice remain unchanged within this decade, we estimate ~ 2.5 billion USD could be lost between 2022 and 2030."
https://bmcmedicine.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12916-023-02882-y

title: Novel Rutgers vaccine may provide more durable protection against SARS-CoV-2

last_post.content:
I post a fair amount of concerning news about #COVID19, so here's some potential good news. A vaccine developed at Rutgers is showing promise for long-lasting protection from COVID, and it's cheap to produce and distribute without special low-temperature handling. It needs more testing, but perhaps better population-wide protection is on the horizon?

title: AI Needs Specialized Processors. Crypto Miners Say They Have Them

last_post.content:
Despite their differences, AI startups and crypto miners are both hungry for GPUs because they depend on brute-force technologies. Hype to the contrary, neither transformers nor proof-of-work blockchains depend on computational subtlety but on grinding away at a billion answers hoping to emerge randomly with the right one.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-05-10/ether-crypto-miners-woo-artificial-intelligence-ai-with-gpu-chips-services

title: Guppe Groups Platform Co-op - Open Collective

last_post.content: Thank you for the all the support for Guppe! It feels great to know that you all value this tool so much. As of now, we have enough membership contributions to cover the server costs, so Guppe will not be shutting down. We are still trying to raise more to have enough to cover the labor costs of maintaining it, adding fixes for compatibility with new Fediverse platforms, and adding new features like democratic moderation using polls, but, with the immediate costs covered, we have more time to try to reach those goals.

title: Cours élémentaire de statistique administrative: élaboration des statistiques, organisation des bureaux de statistique, éléments de démographie; ouvrage conforme au programme arrêté par le Conseil Supérieur de Statistiquepour lexamen dadmission dans diverses administrations publiques : Bertillon, Jacques, 1851-1919 : Free Download, Borrow, and Streaming : Internet Archive

last_post.content:
La carte de Jacques Bertillon, donc : elle réussit à présenter simplement pour chacun des ~70 quartiers considérés
- la population du quartier (largeur du rectangle),
- la proportion d'étrangers (sa hauteur),
- et donc le nombre absolu d'étrangers (sa surface).

Now the #Bluesky community is quickly discovering what the rest of the Fediverse has known for half a decade: that having everyone flock to one server makes for a pretty awful community experience.

The only way to fight Nazis is to quarantine the bad actors so thoroughly that they're pretty much screaming into the void.

Mind you, mastodon.social is at risk of repeating the same old mistakes which is why I hope it stops being the default server for newbies to join.

Nevertheless, this is why I talk on and on about decentralization. This is one such way decentralization benefits social media: by giving people the option to shut out the Nazis.

I am super stoked to announce our new ​:calckey:​ server, https://calckey.lgbt ​:progresspride_flag:​ 🎉

We are a safe space for LGBTQIA+ individuals and staunch allies and sister server to outdoors.lgbt

Signups are open! We would love to have you! ​:heart_trans:​

I'd like to thank @supakaity@blahaj.zone for adding an edit feature to #Calckey. Within a day that I've been able to use this, it's been such a huge quality of life improvement for me. I no longer have to stress out because I misspelled something or forgot a word in a sentence.

She does so much great work. Please show some appreciation and love for this incredible Calckey developer!

💓

title: Climate-friendly software: don't fight the wrong battle

last_post.content:
What if I told you that most promoted actions about climate-friendly software are misguided?

Backing data for that claim and my opinion on the low-hanging fruits:

https://blog.ltgt.net/climate-friendly-software/

Key takeaways:
* Pick servers in carbon-neutral or low-carbon datacenters first
* Optimize for the perceived performance and battery life
* Don't be the one that will make your users change their device
* Sometimes, ideas aren't even worth their impacts

#greenIT #climate #sustainability #carbonfootprint #co2

title: Grace Murray Hopper (1906-1992): A legacy of innovation and service

last_post.content:
Born in 1906, computer scientist Grace Hopper invented the first compiler for computer programming language & was among the first programmers of the Harvard Mk1 computer.

Hopper popularized the idea of machine-independent programming languages & paved the way to develop COBOL (an early high-level programming language). She originated the term "bug" to describe computer glitches & became a celebrated Rear Admiral in the US Navy.
https://news.yale.edu/2017/02/10/grace-murray-hopper-1906-1992-legacy-innovation-and-service #HistoryRemix #science #history

title: Google is changing up search. What does that mean for news publishers?

last_post.content:
The nature of business models online will change drastically between this decade and the last. The first major change is the war against online advertising fron the GDPR to Apple ATT to Google’s cookie apocalypse.

LLMs changing search engines to answer engines will be the next major shift. It’s going to be increasingly harder to exist, let alone thrive as a publisher online.

https://www.niemanlab.org/2023/05/google-is-changing-up-search-what-does-that-mean-for-news-publishers/

title: New Baby Bonds Bill Seeks to Help Kids Who Lost Parents to COVID

last_post.content:
As part of the publicly funded initiative, the state will invest $1,000 per year for eligible minors. Once a child turns 18, they can use the funds to pay for an education, buy a home or start a business.

title: Holy Island/Ynys Gybi, Anglesey, North Wales, Spring > — Ian Cylkowski Photography. Photography

last_post.content:
Ynys Gybi, or "Holy Island", is located off the northwestern shore of Anglesey, North Wales.

It features epic sea stacks and sheer cliffs of fabulous geology.

An on a cloudy and dark day, the area was even more moody.

Lots more photos from this day are available for you here -> https://www.iancylkowski.com/blog/2023/5/12/holy-island-ynys-gybi-anglesey-north-wales-spring 👍

#landscape #seascape #spring #nature #travel #uk #britain #wales #northwales #anglesey #photography #photo #photographie

title: Matt Blaze: Testing Phone-Sized Faraday Bags

last_post.content:
For some reason, I got a ton (or at least several ounces) of people asking me about Faraday bags for phones the last couple days.

While I’m not in the Faraday bag testing business, you might find this writeup I did a couple years ago helpful, mainly to explore how you can think about what Faraday bags do and don’t do and how to measure them. Go science!

https://www.mattblaze.org/blog/faraday/

This is one of my dissatisfactions with both software engineering and computing education: neither thinks that criticism in the sense of literary, music, or film criticism is something they should do or reward. Twenty years on, most books and courses on software architecture & software design still don't describe actual, specific systems in pedagogically-useful detail https://third-bit.com/sdxjs/introduction/#introduction-history
